adb_data_warehouse_db_name.description: The database name of the Autonomous Data Warehouse.

adw-oac.longDescription: This architecture uses Oracle Autonomous Data Warehouse to load and optimize data from multiple flat-file sources into a centralized data warehouse and then uses Oracle Analytics Cloud to analyze the data to provide actionable insights. Learn more
adw-oac.stackDescription: Provision Autonomous Data Warehouse and Oracle Analytics Cloud to ingest data from multiple flat-file sources and analyze it

autonomous_database_cpu_core_count.title: OCPU Count
autonomous_database_cpu_core_count.description: The number of OCPU cores to enable. Available cores are subject to your tenancy's service limits.

autonomous_database_admin_password.title: Autonomous Database Admin Password
autonomous_database_admin_password.description: The name must contain only letters and numbers, starting with a letter. Maximum of 14 characters.

autonomous_database_display_name.title: Display Name
autonomous_database_display_name.description: A user-friendly name to help you easily identify the resource.

autonomous_database_is_auto_scaling_enab.title: Auto Scaling
autonomous_database_is_auto_scaling_enab.description: Allows system to use up to three times the provisioned number of cores as the workload increases.

autonomous_database_data_storage_size_in.title: Storage (TB)
autonomous_database_data_storage_size_in.description: The amount of storage to allocate.

autonomous_database_data_safe_status.title: Autonomous Database Data Safe Status
autonomous_database_data_safe_status.description: Do you wish to register the Autonomous Data Warehouse with Oracle Data Safe?

my_public_ip.title: Public IP Address
my_public_ip.description: Enter your computerâ€™s public IP address.

analytics_instance_capacity_capacity_typ.title: Capacity Type
analytics_instance_capacity_capacity_typ.description: Choose how you want to size the Analytics instance.

analytics_instance_feature_set.title: Feature Set
analytics_instance_feature_set.description: Choose the features you want to deploy. Self-service analytics deploys an instance with data visualization. Enterprise analytics deploys an instance with enterprise modeling, reporting, and data visualization.

analytics_instance_license_type.title: License Type
analytics_instance_license_type.description: Select whether you want to use your Oracle Middleware on-premises license with Oracle Analytics Cloud and be charged the Bring Your Own License (BYOL) rate or use an Oracle Cloud license for Oracle Analytics Cloud.

analytics_instance_name.title: Instance Name
analytics_instance_name.description: Enter a name for the Oracle Analytics Cloud instance.

analytics_instance_idcs_access_token.title: Analytics Instance IDCS Access Token
analytics_instance_idcs_access_token.description: Paste the IDCS Access Token. You should download the IDCS Access token as mentioned https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/identity-cloud/uaids/generate-personal-access-tokens.html

apmSyntheticDvp.longDescription: Provides an easy way to set up a Dedicated Vantage Point in Application Performance Monitoring and register it with APM Domains.
apmSyntheticDvp.solutionName: Application Performance Monitoring Synthetic Dedicated Vantage Point
apmSyntheticDvp.stackDescription: Provision the infrastructure and prerequisites for a Dedicated Vantage Point in Application Performance Monitoring.

dvp_current_user.title: User Name
dvp_current_user.description: User name of the user creating the stack.

dvp_tenant.title: Tenant
dvp_tenant.description: Tenancy in which the stack will be created.

dvp_stack_config_name.title: Dedicated Vantage Point Name
dvp_stack_config_name.description: A constant unique name of dedicated vantage point, which will be used to register Dedicated Vantage Point with APM domains and also prefixed to the infrastructure resources created by the stack.

dvp_network_compartment.title: Network Compartment
dvp_network_compartment.description: Network compartment in which the Virtual Cloud Network (VCN) resides. NOTE: In edit, change in network compartment is not supported.

dvp_vcn.title: VCN
dvp_vcn.description: VCN in which the Dedicated Vantage Point cluster will be created. NOTE: In edit, change in VCN name is not supported.

dvp_worker_node_subnet.title: Cluster Worker Nodes Subnet
dvp_worker_node_subnet.description: Subnet used by the worker nodes in the Dedicated Vantage Point cluster. NOTE: In edit, change in private subnet is not supported.

dvp_kubernetes_api_endpoint_subnet.title: Public Kubernetes API Endpoint Subnet
dvp_kubernetes_api_endpoint_subnet.description: Public subnet to host the Oracle Kubernetes Engine (OKE) API public endpoint. NOTE: In edit, change in public subnet is not supported.

dvp_auth_token.title: Auth Token
dvp_auth_token.description: Auth Token for the user executing this stack, that will be used to push/pull APM Synthetic images (Synthetics Deployment Manager, Synthetics Side Agent and Synthetics Rest Agent) to/from OCIR. Refer this for generating an Auth Token.

dvp_data_keys.title: Domain Private Data Keys
dvp_data_keys.description: List of data key objects in JSON format.

cluster_kubernetes_version.title: Cluster Kubernetes Version
cluster_kubernetes_version.description: Kubernetes Version of Cluster Worker Nodes. NOTE: Downgrade of kubernetes version is not supported.

dvp_node_pool_shape.title: Dedicated Vantage Point Node Pool Compute Shape
dvp_node_pool_shape.description: Compute instance shape of the worker nodes to be created in the Dedicated Vantage Point node pool.

dvp_node_pool_size.title: Dedicated Vantage Point Node Pool Size
dvp_node_pool_size.description: Number of worker nodes in the Dedicated Vantage Point node pool.

dvp_use_endpoint_proxy.title: Use Target URL Proxy?
dvp_use_endpoint_proxy.description: If monitored targets are behind a proxy server, then provide the proxy details to access them.

dvp_endpoint_proxy_port.title: Target proxy server Port
dvp_endpoint_proxy_port.description: Enter port number for target proxy server, example: 8080

dvp_endpoint_bypass_proxy.title: Bypass url list for target proxy
dvp_endpoint_bypass_proxy.description: Enter comma-separated hosts to bypass proxy settings. You can also use an asterisk * to replace a string. Example: 127.0.0.1,localhost,*example.com

dvp_endpoint_proxy_type.title: Proxy Auth Type
dvp_endpoint_proxy_type.description: Select the authentication type for the proxy. Default is NONE.

dvp_endpoint_proxy_user.title: Target Proxy User Name
dvp_endpoint_proxy_user.description: Enter user name for Target Proxy.

dvp_use_collector_proxy.title: Use Metric Data Upload Endpoint Proxy?
dvp_use_collector_proxy.description: Provide proxy details to upload monitor metrics.

dvp_collector_proxy_server.title: Metrics Data Upload Endpoint Proxy Server
dvp_collector_proxy_server.description: Enter proxy server for communication with the APM Collector. Example https://127.0.0.1.

dvp_collector_proxy_port.title: Metrics Data Upload Endpoint Proxy Port
dvp_collector_proxy_port.description: Application Performance Monitoring metrics data upload proxy port

dvp_collector_bypass_proxy.title: Metrics Data Upload Endpoint Bypass Proxy
dvp_collector_bypass_proxy.description: Enter comma-separated hosts to bypass proxy settings. You can also use an asterisk * to replace a string. Example: 127.0.0.1,localhost,*example.com

dvp_collector_proxy_user.title: Metrics Data Upload Endpoint Proxy User
dvp_collector_proxy_user.description: User name of the APM collector proxy user.

dvp_collector_proxy_password.title: Metrics Data Upload Endpoint Proxy Password
dvp_collector_proxy_password.description: Password of the metrics data upload proxy user.

dvp_node_pool_ssh_public_key.title: SSH Public Key for Cluster Worker Nodes
dvp_node_pool_ssh_public_key.description: Provide the SSH Public Key for Cluster Worker Nodes. NOTE: It will be applied only to new nodes.

dvp_is_logging_enabled.title: Enable Logging?
dvp_is_logging_enabled.description: This will enable uploading logs to OCI Logging service.

dvp_is_autoupgrade_enabled.title: Enable Auto Upgrade?
dvp_is_autoupgrade_enabled.description: This will enable auto upgrade of DVP deployment manager and monitors to latest version. Default is true.

dvp_enable_vault.title: Enable Vault Support?
dvp_enable_vault.description: Use a vault to store secrets and manage encrypted resources. NOTE: In edit, only enable vault operation is supported.

dvp_use_existing_vault.title: Use Existing Vault?
dvp_use_existing_vault.description: Use an existing vault to store secrets and manage encrypted resources. If this option is not selected, then a new vault will be created.

dvp_existing_vault_id.title: Select a vault
dvp_existing_vault_id.description: A new master encryption key will be created.

dvp_vault_name.title: Vault Name
dvp_vault_name.description: A new vault and a master encryption key will be created.

hubSpoke.longDescription: Provides an easy way to set up a hub-and-spoke network topology connecting to multiple VCNs in the same region. Common use cases for this topology include segregating environments for different workloads (such as development and production), segregating data to meet compliance requirements (such as PCI DSS and HIPAA), and enabling IT infrastructure shared services (such as email and IAM). Learn more
hubSpoke.stackDescription: Provision a hub-and-spoke network topology in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

sampleMultiTierWindowsServerBasedCoreAsp.longDescription: Provides a quick way to create a multi tier application with a load balancer with windows servers behind them and deployed with an ASP.net core web application deployed to it

instance_shape.description: A shape is a template that determines the number of CPUs, amount of memory, and other resources allocated to a newly created instance.

computeInstance.longDescription: Provides an easy way to launch Compute instances and optionally create and attach any number of block volumes. Note: Oracle-provided images include rules that restrict access to the boot and block volumes. We recommend that you do not use custom images without these rules unless you understand the security risks. See Compute Best Practices for recommendations on how to manage instances.
computeInstance.stackDescription: Provision a Compute instance in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

instance_display_name.title: Compute Instance Display Name
instance_display_name.description: Display name of the compute instance

extended_metadata.title: Extended Metadata
extended_metadata.description: Additional metadata key/value pairs provided by the user

ipxe_script.title: IPXE (Preboot eXecution Environment) Script
ipxe_script.description: The iPXE script that initiates the boot process on the compute instance

preserve_boot_volume.title: Preserve Boot Volume
preserve_boot_volume.description: Specifies whether to delete or preserve the boot volume when terminating an instance

boot_volume_size_in_gbs.title: Boot Volume Size in Gigabytes
boot_volume_size_in_gbs.description: The size of the boot volume in GBs

shape.title: Instance Shape
shape.description: A shape is a template that determines the number of CPUs, amount of memory, and other resources allocated to a newly created instance.

assign_public_ip.title: Assign Public IP
assign_public_ip.description: Whether the VNIC should be assigned a public IP address

vnic_name.title: VNIC Name
vnic_name.description: A user-friendly name for the VNIC

hostname_label.title: Host Name
hostname_label.description: The hostname for the VNIC's primary private IP

private_ip.title: Private IP
private_ip.description: Private IP address of your choice to assign to the VNICs.

skip_source_dest_check.title: Skip the Source/Destination Check
skip_source_dest_check.description: Whether the source/destination check is disabled on the VNIC

subnet_ocid.title: Subnet
subnet_ocid.description: The subnet in which the instance primary VNICs are created. The Subnets template is one way to quickly and easily create a subnet.

vcn_ocid.title: Virtual Cloud Network (VCN)
vcn_ocid.description: The virtual cloud network to use with the compute instance. You can use the Subnets template to create a VCN.

ssh_public_key.title: SSH Public Key
ssh_public_key.description: Public SSH key to be included in the ~/.ssh/authorized_keys file for the default user on the instance

user_data.title: User Data
user_data.description: Provide your own base64-encoded data to be used by Cloud-Init to run custom scripts or provide custom Cloud-Init configuration.

source_ocid.title: Source OCID
source_ocid.description: The unique identifier (OCID) of an image or a boot volume to use, depending on the value of Source Type. The given default OCID is for the Oracle Linux 7 image in the us-phoenix-1 region.

source_type.title: Source Type
source_type.description: The source type for the instance. Use image when specifying the image unique identifier (OCID). Use bootVolume when specifying the boot volume OCID.

block_storage_size_in_gbs.title: Block Storage Size in Gigabytes
block_storage_size_in_gbs.description: Size of a volume to create and attach to the instance.

use_chap.title: Use CHAP
use_chap.description: Whether to use CHAP authentication for the volume attachment

resource_platform.title: Resource Platform
resource_platform.description: The platform on which resources should be created

subnets.longDescription: Provides a quick way to provision subnets in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
subnets.stackDescription: Provision subnets in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

vcn_id.title: Virtual Cloud Network ID
vcn_id.description: The VCN ID where the Subnet(s) should be created.

vcn_cidr.title: VCN CIDR
vcn_cidr.description: The CIDR of the VCN (used when dynamically generating subnet CIDRs, if a specific CIDR is not otherwise given).

dns_label.title: DNS Label
dns_label.description: A label to use with the DNS instance that will be created

dns_enabled.title: DNS Enabled
dns_enabled.description: Should DNS be enabled on the subnet

subnet_display_name.title: Subnet Display Name
subnet_display_name.description: The display name of the subnet

vcn_display_name.title: VCN Display Name
vcn_display_name.description: The display name of the VCN

prohibit_public_ip_on_vnic.title: Prohibit Public IP on VNIC
prohibit_public_ip_on_vnic.description: Should public IP be enabled on the VNIC

block_volume_display_name.description: Display name of the block volume

kms_key_id.description: The OCID of the Key Management key which is the master encryption key for the volume

volume_group_display_name.description: Display name of the Block Volume Group

ociDevTools.stackDescription: Provision a Compute instance with Oracle Cloud developer tools installed.
ociDevTools.longDescription: Provides an Oracle Cloud developer environment with the OCI CLI, SDKs, Terraform and Ansible pre-installed. Learn more.
ociDevTools.informationalText: To connect to the compute instance, copy the ssh private key pem content into a file on your machine, then run the command: [ssh -i opc@]. NOTE: The auto-generated SSH private key should not be used in a production environment. Learn more about using the Oracle Cloud Development Kit.

instance_shape.title: Instance Shape
instance_shape.description: The shape for the compute instance

generate_ssh_key_pair.title: Auto-generate SSH key pair
generate_ssh_key_pair.description: SSH key-pair is generated when this option is selected. It is not safe to use this option for production systems because the private key is stored in terraform state file and can be viewed by anyone who has access to the stack. Uncheck this box if you want to generate an SSH key pair and upload the public key.

ssh_public_key.title: SSH Public Key
ssh_public_key.description: The public SSH key for the key-pair that you want to use to login to instances via SSH.

use_tenancy_level_policy.title: Compute instance to access all resources at tenancy level
use_tenancy_level_policy.description: If this checkbox is selected, the dynamic group policy is created to give all resources access to the compute instance at the tenancy level . If unselected, the dynamic group policy is created to give all resources accesss to the compute instance at the compartment level

variables.wpDbUserDescription: The username that WordPress uses to connect to the MySQL database.
variables.wpSchemaTitle: MySQL schema to be used by WordPress
variables.wpAdminUserDescription: The username for the WordPress administrator.
variables.wpAdminPasswordDescription: The password must be more than 8 characters and include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one of the following special characters: !@#%^*_+-:?.,[]\{\}
variables.vcnDescription: Type VCN name where your WordPress will be deployed.
variables.vcnCidrDescription: Choose VCN CIDR for your WordPress deployment.
variables.compartmentOcidDescription: Compartment where your WordPress will be deployed.
variables.availabilityDomainNameDescription: Choose Availability Domain where your WordPress will be deployed.
variables.instanceShapeDescription: Choose Instance Shape for WordPress host.
variables.instanceOcpusDescription: You can customize the number of OCPUs to a flexible shape.
variables.instanceShapeConfigMemoryInGbsDescriptio: You can customize the amount of memory allocated to a flexible shape.
variables.instanceOsDescription: An Operating System that determines the operating system for WordPress host.
variables.linuxOsVersionDescription: An Operating System version that determines the operating system version for WordPress host.
variables.publicSshKeyTitle: Import your own SSH public key
variables.publicSshKeyDescription: In order to access your private nodes with a public SSH key you will need to set up a bastion host (a.k.a. jump box). If using public nodes, bastion is not needed. Left blank to not import keys.

outputs.instancePublicIp1Description: Public IP for connecting to instance 1 over Remote Desktop
outputs.instancePublicIp2Description: Public IP for connecting to instance 2 over Remote Desktop
outputs.lbPublicIpDescription: Open the ASP.NET application deployed to OCI

variables.instancePasswordTitle: Password for the Windows opc user
variables.instancePasswordDescription: Used to sign in to the instance using remote desktop. Password must be at least 12 characters long and include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one of the following special characters: !@#%^*_+-:?.,[]\{\}.
variables.loadBalancerShapeDetailsMaximumBandwidth: Maximum Bandwidth the Load Balancer will scale to.
variables.loadBalancerShapeDetailsMinimumBandwidth: Minimum Bandwidth the Load Balancer will scale to.
variables.availabilityDomainDescription: The availability domain to deploy the compute instances

jenkinsQuickstarts.longDescription: Deploy containerized Jenkins server on OCI using a single compute instance.

variables.publicSshKeyTitle: Import your own SSH public key
variables.jenkinsUserDescription: The username to sign in to Jenkins.
variables.jenkinsPasswordDescription: The password must be 8-32 characters and include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one of the following special characters: !@#%^*_+-:?.,[]\{\}
variables.vcnDescription: Type VCN name where your Jenkins will be deployed.
variables.vcnCidrDescription: Choose VCN CIDR for your Jenkins deployment.
variables.availabilityDomainNameDescription: Choose Availability Domain where your Jenkins will be deployed.
variables.instanceShapeDescription: Choose Instance Shape for Jenkins host.
variables.instanceOsDescription: An Operating System that determines the operating system for Jenkins host.
variables.linuxOsVersionDescription: An Operating System version that determines the operating system version for Jenkins host.
variables.generatePublicSshKeyDescription: Generates an SSH key pair when selected. You can download the keys. Uncheck to provide your own public key.
variables.publicSshKeyDescription: In order to access your private nodes with a public SSH key you will need to set up a bastion host (a.k.a. jump box). If using public nodes, bastion is not needed. Left blank to not import keys.

mushopQuickstarts.longDescription: A demo eCommerce example app (MuShop Basic) using Always-Free Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.
mushopQuickstarts.stackDescription: Three-tier web application using Always-Free resources

variables.useEncryptionFromOciVaultTitle: Encrypt boot volume and object storage bucket with a key that you manage?
variables.createNewEncryptionKeyTitle: Create new vault and encryption key?
variables.createVaultPoliciesForGroupTitle: Create policies for the user group to manage vault and keys?
variables.userAdminGroupForVaultPolicyTitle: Specific your group to include the policy
variables.useOnlyAlwaysFreeElegibleResourcesTitle: Use only always free eligible resources?
variables.instanceShapeTitle: Select a shape for the compute instances
variables.lbShapeTitle: Select a shape for the load balancer
variables.createLpgPoliciesForGroupTitle: Create policies for the user group to manage local peering gateways?
variables.userAdminGroupForLpgPolicyTitle: Specify your group to include the policy
variables.objectStorageMushopMediaReadParExpiratio: Object Storage Media PAR expiration date
variables.numNodesDescription: Choose the number of compute instances to deploy.
variables.autonomousDatabaseNameDescription: The name for the Autonomous Database instance. The deployment id (4 characters random string) will be added to the end of the DB name.
variables.showAdvancedDescription: Shows advanced options, allowing enable customer managed encryption keys, select your ssh key, and other advanced options. NOTE: Only encryption and ssh key changes are available as Always Free resources, other advanced options may not be available on the Always Free.
variables.generatePublicSshKeyDescription: Auto-generate a public key and assign to the compute instances. Uncheck to provide your own public key or leave blank not to use any attach any key to the compute instance.
variables.publicSshKeyDescription: The public SSH key for the key-pair that you want to use, if you wish to login to the instances over SSH.
variables.isPvEncryptionInTransitEnabledDescriptio: Encrypts data in transit between the instance and the boot volume. In-transit encryption for boot and block volumes is only available for virtual machine (VM) instances launched from Oracle-provided images, it is not supported on bare metal instances.
variables.useEncryptionFromOciVaultDescription: By default, Oracle manages the keys that encrypt the boot volume and object storage bucket, but you can choose a key from a vault that you have access to if you want greater control over the key's lifecycle and how it's used.
variables.createNewEncryptionKeyDescription: Creates new vault and key on OCI Vault/Key Management/KMS and assign to boot volume of compute and object storage bucket.
variables.encryptionKeyIdDescription: Use an existent master encryption key to encrypt boot volume and object storage bucket. NOTE: If the key resides in a different compartment or in a different tenancy, make sure you have the proper policies to access, or the provision of Object Storage and Compute will fail.
variables.createVaultPoliciesForGroupDescription: Creates policies to allow the user applying the stack to manage vault and keys. If you are on the Administrators group or already have the policies for a compartment, this policy is not needed. If you do not have access to allow the policy, ask your administrator to include it for you.
variables.userAdminGroupForVaultPolicyDescription: Identity Group to allow manage vault and keys.
variables.useOnlyAlwaysFreeElegibleResourcesDescri: *** Unchecking this may use options that are not included or supported by Always Free eligible resources.
variables.instanceShapeDescription: A shape is a template that determines the number of CPUs, amount of memory, and other resources allocated to a newly created instance.
variables.instanceOcpusDescription: You can customize the number of OCPUs allocated to a flexible shape.
variables.instanceShapeConfigMemoryInGbsDescriptio: You can customize the amount of memory allocated to a flexible shape.
variables.imageOperatingSystemDescription: The OS/image installed on all compute instances.
variables.imageOperatingSystemVersionDescription: The OS/image version installed on all compute instances.
variables.instanceVisibilityDescription: The instance visibility will define if assign a public ip address to the compute instance and if the subnet is public or private.
variables.lbShapeDescription: A load balancer provides automated traffic distribution from one entry point to multiple servers in a backend set. The load balancer ensures that your services remain available by directing traffic only to healthy servers in the backend set.
variables.lbShapeDetailsMinimumBandwidthInMbpsDesc: Enter the minimum size of the flexible shape.
variables.lbShapeDetailsMaximumBandwidthInMbpsDesc: Enter the maximum size of the flexible shape (Should be bigger than minimum size). The maximum service limit is set by your tenancy limits.
variables.lbCompartmentOcidDescription: The compartment in which to create the Public Load Balancer.
variables.createSecondaryVcnDescription: Creates a secondary VCN for the LoadBalancer with local peering to the main VCN.
variables.createLpgPoliciesForGroupDescription: Creates policies to allow the user applying the stack to create a local peering gateway. If you are on the Administrators group or already have the policies for a compartment, this policy is not needed. If you do not have access to allow the policy, ask your administrator to include it for you.
variables.userAdminGroupForLpgPolicyDescription: Identity Group to allow manage local peering gateways.
variables.autonomousDatabaseIsFreeTierDescription: Uses Always Free Transaction Processing Autonomous Database. Unchecking this option will provision a regular 1 OCPU ATP instance with License.
variables.autonomousDatabaseVisibilityDescription: NOTE: Currently private endpoints are only supported if use local terraform. | If Private, creates the ADB with private endpoint. The autonomous database visibility will define if assign the ATP to a private subnet or allow secure access from everywhere.
variables.objectStorageMushopMediaCompartmentOcidD: The compartment in which to create the Public MuShop product images.
variables.objectStorageMushopMediaVisibilityDescri: Public creates a public bucket for the mushop media product images. Private creates a private bucket and populates the catalogue service with the images.
variables.objectStorageMushopMediaReadParExpiratio: The name for the Autonomous Database instance.

outputs.generatedPrivateKeyPemTitle: Generated Private Key for SSH Access
outputs.generatedPrivateKeyPemDescription: Generated Private Key for ssh access to compute nodes
outputs.commentsDescription: The application URL will be unavailable for a few minutes after provisioning, while the application is configured

variables.autonomousDatabaseAdminPasswordTitle: Database ADMIN Password (Required for APEX Administration)
variables.autonomousDatabaseAdminPasswordDescripti: Password must be 12 to 30 characters and contain at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, and one number. The password cannot contain double quotation marks or the username 'admin'.
variables.autonomousDatabaseWorkloadTypeTitle: Enable support for Oracle Database Client connectivity (SQL*NET)
variables.autonomousDatabaseWorkloadTypeDescriptio: Instead of provisioning specialized APEX Service and Autonomous Database, creates a full Autonomous Transaction Processing database with APEX included.

autonomousDatabase.longDescription: Provides a quick way to create a basic Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Autonomous Database setup for DW, OLTP & AJD Workloads

autonomous_database_name.title: Autonomous Database Name
autonomous_database_name.description: The name for the Autonomous Database instance. The deployment id (4 characters random string) will be added to the end of the DB name.

admin_password.title: Database Admin password
admin_password.description: Enter password for the database admin user, default is Welcome#1234

cpu_core_count.title: OCPU core count
cpu_core_count.description: Count of OCPUs to be used, value is between 1 to 128, default is 1

data_storage_size_in_tbs.title: Data storage size in tbs
data_storage_size_in_tbs.description: Data storage size in TBs to be used, value is between 1 to 128, default is 1

autonomous_database_db_workload.title: ADB Workload
autonomous_database_db_workload.description: Choose ADB Workload, Default is Data warehouse DW

autonomous_database_license_model.title: License Model
autonomous_database_license_model.description: Choose License Model, Please Note AJD does not support BRING_YOUR_OWN_LICENSE

is_auto_scaling_enabled.title: Auto Scaling
is_auto_scaling_enabled.description: Is Auto Scaling Enabled ? default is Yes

is_data_guard_enabled.title: Autonomous Data Guard
is_data_guard_enabled.description: Is Autonomous Data Guard Enabled ? default is No

autonomous_database_data_safe_status.title: Data Safe Status
autonomous_database_data_safe_status.description: Autonomous Database Data Safe Status, Default is NOT_REGISTERED

operations_insights_status.title: Operations Insights
operations_insights_status.description: Status of Operations Insights for this Autonomous Database. Values supported are ENABLED and NOT_ENABLED

resource_naming_prefix.title: Resource Naming Prefix
resource_naming_prefix.description: A unique prefix to use when naming resources.

awx_cluster_name.title: AWX Cluster Name
awx_cluster_name.description: A unique name for the cluster on which to deploy AWX.

image_operating_system.title: Instance Image Operating System
image_operating_system.description: Name of operating system image for worker nodes.

image_operating_system_version.title: Instance Image Operating System Version
image_operating_system_version.description: Version of operating system image for worker nodes.

instance_shape.title: Instance Shape
instance_shape.description: Name of a shape for worker nodes. The shape must support more than 6 OCPUs, and more than 8 GB of memory

shape_ocpus.title: Instance Shape OCPU
shape_ocpus.description: Number of OCPUs for the shape. Must be more than 6 OCPUs.

shape_mems.title: Instance Shape Memory
shape_mems.description: Amount of memory for the shape (in GBs). Must be more than 8 GB.

awx_execution_env_image_name.title: Execution Environment Docker Image
awx_execution_env_image_name.description: Execution environment Docker image, which is required to use OCI Ansible Collections.

awx_node_ssh_public_key.title: AWX Node SSH Public Key
awx_node_ssh_public_key.description: Public SSH key to access worker nodes in the cluster on which AWX is deployed.

tag_cost_center.description: CostCenter tag value. Allows printable ASCII, excluding periods (.) and spaces and max 100 characters.

tag_geo_location.title: Tag Geo Location
tag_geo_location.description: GeoLocation tag value. Allows printable ASCII, excluding periods (.) and spaces and max 100 characters.

parent_compartment_name.title: Parent Compartment Name
parent_compartment_name.description: Name of the top level / parent compartment. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

workload_compartment_names.title: Workload Compartment Names
workload_compartment_names.description: List of up to five application workload compartment names. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

network_compartment_name.title: Network Compartment Name
network_compartment_name.description: Name of the top level network compartment. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

security_compartment_name.title: Security Compartment Name
security_compartment_name.description: Name of the top level security compartment. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

common_infra_compartment_name.title: Common Infra Compartment Name
common_infra_compartment_name.description: Name of the top level common infrastructure compartment. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

applications_compartment_name.title: Applications Compartment Name
applications_compartment_name.description: Name of the top level application compartment. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique within its parent compartment.

break_glass_user_email_list.title: Break Glass User Email List
break_glass_user_email_list.description: Unique list of break glass user email addresses that do not exist. These users are added to the Administrator group in the tenancy.

show_extra_iam_vars.title: Show Security Policy Variables
show_extra_iam_vars.description: Show security policy variables. If you already have a vault and encryption key provisioned.

key_id.title: Key Id
key_id.description: Master encryption key OCID for security admin policy.

vault_id.title: Vault Id
vault_id.description: Vault OCID for security admin policy.

workload_admins_group_name.title: Workload Admins Group Named
workload_admins_group_name.description: The name for the workload administrators group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

cloud_guard_analysts_group_name.title: Cloud Guard Analyst Group Name
cloud_guard_analysts_group_name.description: The name of the Cloud Guard Analyst group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

cloud_guard_architects_group_name.title: Cloud Guard Architects Group Name
cloud_guard_architects_group_name.description: The name of the Cloud Guard Architect group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

cloud_guard_operators_group_name.title: Cloud Guard Operators Group Name
cloud_guard_operators_group_name.description: The name of the Cloud Guard Operator group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

lb_users_group_name.title: Load Balancer User Group Name
lb_users_group_name.description: The name for the load balancer users group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

network_admin_group_name.title: Network Admins Group Name
network_admin_group_name.description: The name for the network administrator group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

security_admins_group_name.title: Security Admins Group Name
security_admins_group_name.description: The name for the security admin group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

workload_storage_admins_group_name.title: Workload Storage Admins Group Name
workload_storage_admins_group_name.description: The name for the workload storage administrators group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

workload_storage_users_group_name.title: Workload Storage Users Group Name
workload_storage_users_group_name.description: The name for the workload storage users group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

workload_users_group_name.title: Workload Users Group Name
workload_users_group_name.description: The name for the workload users group. Maximum 100 characters, including letters, numbers, periods, hyphens, underscores, and is unique across all groups.

vcn_dns_label.title: VCN DNS Label
vcn_dns_label.description: VCN DNS Label. Allowed maximum 15 alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter.

is_public_subnet_enabled.title: Provision public subnet?
is_public_subnet_enabled.description: Used for resources with publicly accessible IP addresses.

private_subnet_cidr_blocks.title: Private Subnet CIDR Blocks
private_subnet_cidr_blocks.description: List of Private Subnet CIDR Block (one per workload, maximum of five).

private_subnet_dns_labels.title: Private Subnet DNS Labels
private_subnet_dns_labels.description: List of Private Subnet DNS Label (one per workload, maximum of five). Allowed maximum 15 alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter.

public_subnet_dns_label.title: Public Subnet DNS Label
public_subnet_dns_label.description: Public Subnet DNS Label. Allowed maximum 15 alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter.

database_subnet_cidr_blocks.title: Database Subnet CIDR Blocks
database_subnet_cidr_blocks.description: List of Database Subnet CIDR Block (one per workload, maximum of five).

database_subnet_dns_labels.title: Database Subnet DNS Labels
database_subnet_dns_labels.description: List of Database Subnet DNS Label (one per workload, maximum of five). Allowed maximum 15 alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter.

egress_rules_map.title: Egress Rules Map
egress_rules_map.description: [Workload Security List] Egress Rules Map. To customize rules for a workload, use the workload name as the value of key.

ingress_rules_map.title: Ingress Rules Map
ingress_rules_map.description: [Workload Security List] Ingress Rules Map. To customize rules for a workload, use the workload name as the value of key.

is_shared_services_subnet_enabled.title: Provision a shared services subnet?
is_shared_services_subnet_enabled.description: Used for shared services e.g. File Storage Service.

shared_service_subnet_dns_label.title: Shared Service Subnet DNS Label
shared_service_subnet_dns_label.description: Shared Service Subnet DNS Label. Allowed maximum 15 alphanumeric characters and must start with a letter.

budget_alerting.title: Budget Alerting
budget_alerting.description: Set to true to enable budget alerting.

budget_alert_rule_message.title: Budget Alert Rule Message
budget_alert_rule_message.description: (Optional if using budget alerts): The alert message for budget alerts.

budget_alert_rule_recipients.title: Budget Alert Rule Recipients
budget_alert_rule_recipients.description: (Optional if using budget alerts): Target email address for budget alerts.

budget_alert_rule_threshold.title: Budget Alert Rule Threshold
budget_alert_rule_threshold.description: (Optional if using budget alerts): The target spending threshold for the budget.

budget_amount.title: Budget Amount
budget_amount.description: (Optional if using budget alerts): The amount of the budget expressed as a number in the currency of the customer's rate card.

advanced_logging_option.title: Enable Advanced Logging?
advanced_logging_option.description: Enable or Disable Advanced Logging (VCN flow logs and/or Audit logs).

retention_rule_duration_time_amount.title: Audit Log Retention Rule Duration Time Amount
retention_rule_duration_time_amount.description: Please note this feature is irreversible after 14 days. Please review (and/or) unlock the retention rule before it is locked permanently. By enabling this feature, logs will be archived in an immutable storage with locked retention rule avoiding object modification and deletion. After the rule is locked, only increase in the retention is allowed.

is_cloud_guard_enabled.title: Enable Cloud Guard?
is_cloud_guard_enabled.description: the status of the Cloud Guard tenant (ENABLED if true or DISABLED if false).

agent_cis_benchmark_settings_scan_level.title: Agent Cis Benchmark Settings Scan Level

host_scan_recipe_agent_settings_scan_lev.title: Host Scan Recipe Agent Settings Scan Level
host_scan_recipe_agent_settings_scan_lev.description: Vulnerability scanning service agent scan level.

host_scan_recipe_port_settings_scan_leve.title: Host Scan Recipe Port Settings Scan Level
host_scan_recipe_port_settings_scan_leve.description: Vulnerability scanning service port scan level.

bastion_client_cidr_block_allow_list.title: Bastion Client CIDR Block Allow List
bastion_client_cidr_block_allow_list.description: A list of address ranges in CIDR notation that bastion is allowed to connect.

use_ipsec_drg.title: Use IPsec DRG?
use_ipsec_drg.description: Choose whether or not to use an IPsec based DRG.

use_fastconnect_drg.title: Use FastConnect?
use_fastconnect_drg.description: Choose whether or not to use FastConnect.

fastconnect_provider.title: FastConnect Provider
fastconnect_provider.description: Available FastConnect providers: AT&T, Microsoft Azure, Megaport, QTS, CEintro, Cologix, CoreSite, Digitial Realty, EdgeConneX, Epsilon, Equinix, InterCloud, Lumen, Neutrona, OMCS, OracleL2ItegDeployment, OracleL3ItegDeployment, Orange, Verizon, Zayo.

virtual_circuit_bandwidth_shape.title: Virtual Circuit Bandwidth Shape
virtual_circuit_bandwidth_shape.description: The provisioned data rate of the connection. Choose between 1 or 10 for FastConnect partner. Or choose between 1, 10 or 100 for FastConnect Direct.

virtual_circuit_cross_connect_mappings_c.title: Virtual Circuit Cross Connect Mappings - Customer BGP peering IP
virtual_circuit_cross_connect_mappings_c.description: This is the BGP IPv4 address of the customer's router. Enter Placeholder value for Non-ASN Virtual Circuits.

virtual_circuit_cross_connect_mappings_o.title: Virtual Circuit Cross Connect Mappings - Oracle BPG Peering IP
virtual_circuit_cross_connect_mappings_o.description: IPv4 address for Oracle's end of the BGP session. Enter Placeholder value for Non-ASN Virtual Circuits.

fastconnect_routing_policy.title: FastConnect Routing Policy
fastconnect_routing_policy.description: Available FastConnect routing policies: ORACLE_SERVICE_NETWORK, REGIONAL, MARKET_LEVEL, GLOBAL.

provider_service_key_name.title: Provider Service Key Name
provider_service_key_name.description: The provider service key that the provider gives you when you set up a virtual circuit connection from the provider to OCI.

virtual_circuit_cross_connect_mappings_c.title: Virtual Circuit Cross Connect Mappings - Customer Secondary BGP Peering IP
